intro: Merostachys, commonly known as the silver grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, silver-hued leaves and delicate, panicle-like inflorescences. The plants typically grow in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories or wet meadows. Merostachys species are often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Their botanical features make them valuable in ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
